bibl.title: Letter from James M. Phalen to Laura Armistead Carter, November 8, 1927

div1.p: Phalen returns Laura Carter's manuscripts and sends his revised biographical sketch of Henry Rose Carter.

div1.head: Letter from James M. Phalen to Laura Armistead Carter, November 8, 1927
div1.opener:
JMP-VTB
Biographic
Please return. Only copy
Phalen
L. A. Carter
WAR DEPARTMENT
ARMY MEDICAL LIBRARY
7TH AND B STREETS SW.
WASHINGTON
November 8, 1927.
Miss Laura A. Carter,
809 Cathedral Street,
Baltimore, Md.
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I am returning herewith your manuscripts and am sending
the revised biographical sketch of your father. As you will note
I have made all the changes indicated in your last note. Your
suggestions were very helpful and improved the sketch materially.
I am very grateful for your help in this matter. I have put off
returning your manuscripts, first because I was not sure of your
address and later on account of my preoccupation in preparing to
leave Washington. I am sailing on the 17th for a three years'
tour of duty in Panama. I am to be stationed at Quarry Heights,
which I know is familiar ground to you. I trust that your health
has been completely restored and that you are quite yourself again.

closer.signed:
James M. Phalen
Colonel, Medical Corps, U.S. Army
